definition: lit. to exert one's horse/fig. war exploits/warhorse
perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
war exploits/(fig.) heroic contribution

sentences.english: Years before, Van Buren had done much himself to elect Jackson to the White House.
sentences.chinese: 几年前，范布伦为杰克逊入主白宫立下了汗马功劳。

sentences.english: Find and scent, my compadres and you too, shall have much rewarding from the master.
sentences.chinese: 同志们，找到气味，主人不会忘记我们的汗马功劳。

sentences.english: Mulan grabbed the rope, but Khan kept slipping toward the edge of a cliff.
sentences.chinese: 木兰抓住了绳索，但是汗马却向着断崖跑去。

sentences.english: Keep you boss aware of your accomplishments.
sentences.chinese: 让老板不断留意你的汗马功劳。

sentences.english: Bazookas have a long range and are very destructive, they make a strong contribution in wars.
sentences.chinese: 火箭炮的射程远，杀伤力强，在战争中立下汗马功劳。

sentences.english: Find and scent, my compadres and you too, shall have much rewarding from the master.
sentences.chinese: 同志们，找到气味，主人不会忘却我们的汗马功劳。
